meanings.definition: Not saturated; having the capacity to absorb or dissolve more of a substance.
meanings.sent1: The unsaturates solution could still take in more sugar.
meanings.sent2: The sponge was unsaturates, ready to soak up any spilled water.
meanings.sent3: The unsaturates cloth eagerly awaited the spilled juice.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like an unsaturates sponge, always thirsty for knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The unsaturates soil welcomed the rain, eager to drink it all in.

meanings.definition: To make unsaturated; to remove or reduce the saturation of a substance.
meanings.sent1: She unsaturates the solution by adding more solvent.
meanings.sent2: The chef unsaturates the sauce to make it less thick.
meanings.sent3: He unsaturates the conversation by injecting humor into it.
meanings.sent4: The artist unsaturates the painting, creating a more subtle effect.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic unsaturates the oil to improve the engine's performance.
